title: Awkward moment Mark Richardson accidentally revealed his co-host is gay live on air
text:
A New Zealand shock jock has been left red faced after he accidentally revealed his co-host is gay live on-air.

Kiwi journalist Ryan Bridges was filling in as the host on The AM Show with Mark Richardson and Amanda Gillies on Thursday when the gaffe happened.

The trio were discussing collections, when Bridges was asked by Gillies what his special collection was.

While Bridges fumbled around for an answer, former New Zealand opening batsmen Richardson blurted out 'ex-boyfriends'.

Ryan Bridges (pictured) has come out as gay after his co-host on live television said he had a collection of ex-boyfriends

Bridges laughed before the trio fell into an awkward silence after Richardson's comment.

After a long pause, Bridges said 'yes, it's true, I'm gay. There we go, it's out there.'

Bridges had never publicly commented on his sexuality, and said it was never something he had tried to hide, with his family and close friends already aware of his sexuality.

'The reason I haven't chosen to share it with you at home, with listeners on my radio show is just that, I don't know, it's just not that interesting, is it?' Bridges said.

'It's just my private business and my life and not something I've really bothered or care to share with the world, but it's out there, so that is that.'

Mark Richardson (pictured left) has been known to cause controversy on air, previously saying everyone should give Donald Trump a chance, that kids need to harden up and that motherhood is not a job

Richardson, 48, has been known to cause controversy on air, previously saying everyone should give Donald Trump a chance, that kids need to harden up and that motherhood is not a job.

He apologised to Bridges later in the show, saying it was an honest mistake.

'In three years of doing this job, this is as bad as I've ever felt,' Richardson said.

'I say a lot of stuff on this show, and I mean it, and some of it walks the line. I just want to say I'm sorry.'

The pair ended the show on good terms.
description: A New Zealand  shock jock has been left red faced after he accidentally revealed his co-host is gay live on-air.
authors: Jackson Barron For Daily Mail Australia
